page.title: 08SHOPPING
page.content: Shopping proves to be an awkward necessity in the area surveyed, with all the inhabitants having to travel between 3 and 5 miles outside the block for their basic needs, e.g. bread, butter and tea etc.. The survey showed that with the complete lack of transport people tried to keep their shopping trips to a minimum, with car owners collecting shopping for neighbours particularly the old or infirm. Once or twice a week is the average with items other than basics requiring 5 extra miles of travel. Larger items such as furniture, carpets etc. are obtained at Chester 30 miles East of the block. In the Winter during periods of snow and ice, shopping can become a difficulty with many minor roads and lanes being totally blocked.
